marketNews.title: Government Plans to Merge 7 State-Owned Construction Companies into 3 Entities
marketNews.content: State-Owned Enterprises Minister, Erick Thohir, stated that the government plans to reduce the number of State-Owned Construction Companies (BUMN Karya) from 7 companies to 3 companies through consolidation. This action is part of the financial recovery efforts for BUMN Karya, which was previously discussed since 2023. Erick mentioned that the entities that will remain after the merger are Adhi Karya ($ADHI), PT PP ($PTPP), and PT Hutama Karya. Subsequently, each resulting entity will be given a focus according to its specific business lines and expertise, with the following details: PT Hutama Karya and Waskita Karya ($WSKT): toll road projects, non-toll roads, institutional building, and residential commercial. PTPP and Wijaya Karya ($WIKA): airport projects, port projects, as well as some remaining residential projects. ADHI, PT Nindya Karya, and PT Brantas Abipraya: construction projects related to water and railway infrastructure. Erick stated that coordination has been conducted with the Ministry of Public Works and Housing and the Ministry of Finance to push this consolidation plan. Erick did not provide a date for when the BUMN Karya consolidation action will be completed, only emphasizing that they still have time to realize this corporate action until October 2024 or before his term ends. Regarding this news, $WIKA and $ADHI declined to comment, while $PTPP stated they are still awaiting clearer direction from the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises. The financial health condition of BUMN Karya has been under scrutiny in recent years, with $WIKA and $WSKT facing a series of PKPU (Postponement of Debt Payment Obligations). Based on the Debt-to-Equity Ratio (DER) metric, all BUMN Karya issuers have high debt levels: WSKT: 9.88x (as of 9M23), WIKA: 4.52x (as of 9M23), PTPP: 1.55x (as of FY23), ADHI: 1.37x (as of FY23). In February 2024, WIKA together with 15 creditors agreed on a master restructuring agreement (MRA) valued at 24.79 trillion rupiah. Key Takeaway: Although details of the merger plan are not yet available, we assess that the consolidation of BUMN Karya can have a positive long-term impact. Besides the capital structure of the merged entities becoming stronger, the division of business focus will also reduce competition and increase specialization. Thus, the profitability of BUMN Karya can increase in the future. Specifically for the PTPP and WIKA merger discourse, we assess that merging both has the potential to provide a negative sentiment for PTPP in the short term. This is because PTPP currently has much better financial health and profitability compared to WIKA. However, the actual impact of the merger between the two companies will depend on the merger scheme. On Friday (22/3), the price of PTPP shares dropped by -2.78%, ADHI was unchanged, while WIKA and WSKT were still under suspension. Related Stocks: $ADHI, $WIKA, $WSKT, $PTPP.

tickerNews.title: INTP: FY23 Net Profit +6% YoY, In Line with Estimates
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa ($INTP) recorded a net profit of 1.95 trillion rupiah (+6% YoY) in 2023, in line with consensus estimates. This result was supported by revenue growth of +10% YoY, while the cost of goods sold (+8.2% YoY) increased more moderately, resulting in gross profit rising +14% YoY. Quarterly, net profit in 4Q23 was recorded at 683 billion rupiah (+20% QoQ, -24% YoY), with revenue of 5 trillion rupiah (+1.3% QoQ, +7.6% YoY).

tickerNews.title: ARTO: Bank Jago's 2023 Net Profit Grew 355% YoY, Reaching 72.4 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Bank Jago ($ARTO) recorded a net profit of 72.4 billion rupiah (+355% YoY) in 2023. This result was supported by Net Interest Income (NII) growth of +17% YoY and other operating income of +152% YoY, leading to operating profit increasing by +582% YoY. Quarterly, net profit in 4Q23 was recorded at 22 billion rupiah (+126% QoQ, recovering from a net loss of 25 billion rupiah in 4Q22), with NII of 374 billion rupiah (-0.7% QoQ, +1.4% YoY).

tickerNews.title: ASII Plans Business Expansion including EV Battery Industry, Electricity Sales, and Hazardous Waste Collection
tickerNews.content: Astra International ($ASII) plans to expand its business activities, including the battery industry for electric vehicles, electricity sales, and hazardous waste collection. This business expansion is based on the company's plan to run additional businesses such as providing electric vehicle (EV) charging station services, EV swap battery stations, EV battery repair, EV battery collection, and other supporting activities. This plan will be discussed at the Annual General Meeting of Shareholders (RGUPST) on April 30, 2024.

tickerNews.title: MPMX Targets 5% YoY Revenue Growth in 2024 and Allocates Capex for Digitalization and Dealer Renovation
tickerNews.content: Mitra Pinasthika Mustika Director, Beatrice Kartika, stated that the company targets revenue growth of +5% YoY in 2024. Beatrice also mentioned that MPMX will allocate capex of 50-75 billion rupiah in 2024, intended for warehouse digitalization and dealer renovation. This capex amount is lower than our estimate of 100-200 billion rupiah, as stated in Mini Unboxing MPMX. This has the potential to increase the company's dividend payout ratio.

tickerNews.title: ADHI Secured New Contracts Worth 4 Trillion Rupiah in January 2024, 90% from Government Projects
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya ($ADHI) recorded a new contract value of 4 trillion rupiah (+106% YoY) in January 2024, equivalent to 10.7% of the 2023 target of 37.4 trillion rupiah. ADHI Corporate Secretary, Farid Budiyanto, stated that the realization of new contracts in January 2024 came from water resource projects amounting to 79%, building projects at 16%, and the remainder consisting of manufacturing, property, and road and bridge projects. 90% of the new contract value originated from the government.

tickerNews.title: Bank Danamon Indonesia (BDMN) Shareholders Approve 2023 Dividend Payout of 1.23 Trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Bank Danamon Indonesia ($BDMN) shareholders approved the distribution of the 2023 fiscal year dividend amounting to 1.23 trillion rupiah or 125.48 per share, equivalent to a 35% dividend payout ratio. The cum-dividend date and payment date have not yet been announced. Referring to BDMN's stock price closing on Friday (22/3) at 3010 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 4.2%.

tickerNews.title: ISAT Prepares 12 Trillion Rupiah Capex in 2024 to Expand Coverage and Enhance Network Quality
tickerNews.content: SVP Head of Corporate Communications Indosat, Steve Saerang, stated that the company allocates capex of 12 trillion rupiah in 2024 (vs. 2023 realization: 12.7 trillion rupiah). These funds will be used to expand coverage, increase capacity, and improve network quality to rural areas, especially in Eastern Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: GGRP Plans to Sell 76.07% Stake in Subsidiary PT Nusantara Baja Profil (NBP) for $319.2 Million
tickerNews.content: Gunung Raja Paksi ($GGRP) plans to sell a 76.07% stake in its subsidiary, PT Nusantara Baja Profil (NBP), worth US$319.2 million or ~4.9 trillion rupiah. The buyers in the transaction are Yamato Kogyo Co. Ltd., Siam Yamato Steel Co. Ltd., and PT Hanwa Indonesia. After this transaction, GGRP's ownership in NBP will decrease to 5%.

tickerNews.title: ESSA Shareholders Approve 2023 Dividend Distribution of 86.13 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Essa Industries Indonesia ($ESSA) shareholders approved the distribution of the 2023 fiscal year dividend amounting to 86.13 billion rupiah or 5 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date and payment date have not yet been announced. Referring to ESSA's stock price closing on Friday (22/3) at 655 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 0.8%.

tickerNews.title: AGRO Plans Share Buyback Up to 60 Billion Rupiah for MESOP
tickerNews.content: Bank Raya Indonesia ($AGRO) plans a share buyback with a maximum value of 60 billion rupiah. The implementation date has not been announced. This corporate action is aimed at the Management and Employee Share Ownership Program (MESOP). This plan will be discussed at the Annual General Meeting of Shareholders (RGUPST) on April 30, 2024.

tickerNews.title: GOOD Plans Share Buyback Up to 46.39 Million Shares with Maximum Funds of 20 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Garudafood Putra Putri Jaya ($GOOD) plans to buy back up to 46.39 million (0.13%) shares with a maximum fund of 20 billion rupiah, resulting in an indicative buyback price of 431 rupiah per share. The implementation date has not yet been announced. This corporate action is aimed at maintaining stock price stability if the company's stock price does not reflect its value or performance. This plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on April 30, 2024.

tickerNews.title: AIMS Plans Rights Issue of up to 770 Million New Shares (250% Dilution) Accompanied by Warrants Issuance
tickerNews.content: Akbar Indo Makmur Stimec ($AIMS) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 770 million new shares (250% of paid-up capital) with a dilution effect of up to 77.8%. This corporate action is also accompanied by the issuance of 77 million warrants with a 10:1 ratio. The exercise price for the rights issue and warrants has not yet been announced. 72% of the proceeds obtained are intended to fund expansion in the entertainment & lifestyle industry, while the remainder is for the acquisition of PT Super Potato Indonesia, PT Raga Citra Mulia, and 1 office unit of 159.2 square meters in Kebayoran Baru. This plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on April 29, 2024.
